head.supplied: St Kilda Road ¶ 16/6/75 ¶ ¶ Herewith, dear Mr [Odg]ers, ¶ I send you the copies of the second fascicle of the educational collections. It would be in the interest of the Department, if they become e...

div.p: G75/6573, unit 258, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof.
This letter was registed in the Education Department as H5970.
St Kilda Road

Herewith, dear Mr [Odg]ers,
obscured in p/c.
I send you the copies of the second fascicle of the educational collections. It would be in the interest of the Department, if they become early distributed, which after the first circular letter would probably require more adressing.

You are aware, that we have made already an inroad on the new votes of the department for the requisite paper & past-board for this collection; so I trust Mr Ramsey, who is well inclined, will arrange with Mr Kerford & Mr Service, that an honorable support is accorded to my Department on the new estimates.
On 18 June W. Odgers minuted: 'Did I not sign a few days agon the Circlr of distribution'; to which [A. G.] responded the next day: 'Yes but it has not gone out. The Fascicles have only just been received'.
A few years later on 22 July 1882, [I. […] K.] minuted: 'There are about 11 sets of this work still in the vault — They are of no possible use here — Possibly the Botanist would be glad to have them — Three parts form a set. Part 3 herewith for inspection'.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Since February all current daily expenses of the service I had to bear out of my private purse, except salary.
